caption: Table 1: Affinity eigen-constraints improved brain score (R²: variance explained).
description: This table presents the results of an experiment evaluating the impact of affinity eigen-constraints on the brain score (R-squared), a measure of the variance explained in brain activity prediction.  The experiment used three different values for the eigen constraint (λeigen): 1.0, 0.1, and 0.  For each constraint value, the table shows the R-squared values obtained for three brain regions of interest (ROIs) - V1, V4, and EBA - along with an overall average across all ROIs.  The results suggest that including the eigen-constraints improves the brain activity prediction performance, with the best performance achieved at λeigen = 1.0.
section: 2.3 Affinity Eigen-constraints as Regularization for Channel Align
